column4: that's detailed in the !dvd link... but you can't "just run that command" pretty sure you have to install libdvdread4
mm no   I run that all the time with no issues   as far as I know it is installed
then it (libdvdread4) must be installed out of the box now
seems to be... i could be wrong however that command always works even on ubuntu 11.04
it works, if libdvdread4 is installed.. if it's not.. it won't work
it works  :)
on the minimal cd, does it give you the choice of which GUI to install, etc?
yes is does  I am not sure if lubuntu desktop is on ther however
ah ok... i think his ram limitations will kinda suck w/ gnome, kde, or xfce
yes indeed, that's why the minimal install cd  at 12 megs is ideal
if he's gonna do that, i'd just download and install lubuntu... wouldn't that be easier?
why not use the lubuntu alternate install cd?
well with only a 12meg cd to burn  there is far less chance of  corrupted downloads
but either way would be fine
yeah, but..c orrupted downloads, vs low system specs, are two separate issues.
this is true  and the minimal install cd relies on internet connection rather than ram
strange, lubuntu doesn't seem to have a alt. cd
ah ok then the minimal install cd  and then  sudo apt-get install lxde  might be the best way to go
yep, you may well be correct on that
thats why choice is a beautiful thing... i prefer lxde
absolutely ,, and if it were not for my loyalties to compiz and cairo dock I probably would swtich  because I refuse to use gnome3
lol
BINGO!!!
